moves.6. e4 O-O 7. Bxc4 c5 8. dxc5 Qa5: This looks correct, but it gives white a slight advantage because he can harass the queen.
moves.9. O-O Qxc5 10. Qe2 Nc6 11. Rac1: A good line for black is 11... h6 12. Bf4 Rd8
moves.11... a6: Too slow.  White is up two moves in development and can play for a strong advantage wit 12. e5
moves.12. Na4:
Not the strongest move.  

Now 12... Qb4 13. Bb3 and black is holding on.
moves.13. Be3 Qb8 14. Nb6: Now 14... Nxe4 Gets something for the exchange.
moves.23... Rd8: By far the strongest is 24. Qc6 Nf5 (24... Qb8 25. Qxa6) 25.  Qxa8 Rxa8 26. Kf2 and white is clearly winning.
moves.24... g6 25. g3 Nf5 26. Bb6 Rd3: White can press his advantage with 27. Qc2 Qe4 (27... Rd7 28. Qc8+) 28. Qg2 Qb4  29. a3 Qb3 30. Qc2 Qd5 31. Rcd1 Rxd1 32. Rxd1 Qb7
moves.27. Rfd1: This gives black a little freedom.  Black should play 27... Rxd1+ 28. Rxd1 Qc6
moves.27... Qd5 28. Rxd3 Qxd3: Now white should play 29 Qc2 Qd5 (Qf3 30. Bf2 Ne3 31. Qc6 with no problems.) 30. Rd1 Qb7
moves.29. Bc5:
This willingness to trade fails by giving Black too many checks. 

Best for black is 29... Bxc5 30. Rxc5 Qb1+ 31. Qf1 (31.  Kg2 Qe4+ 32. Kh3 Ne3) 31... Qxb2
moves.29... Kg7: The computer thinks that this gives white a winning game.  However, the resulting position is so difficult to play that it is very hard for white to win.
moves.30. Bxe7 Nxe7 31. Qc5:
Chases the knight where it wants to go. 

Instead the computer move now is 31. a3  How exactly this helps white or how he can make progress is not clear here.  Then after Nd5 I gave this position to the computer to play out, and it had such a hard time finding a win that I assumed that the game must be a draw.  

After moving somewhat aimlessly for about 100 moves, the computer finally pushed g4 and f5 to reach a winning but difficult endgame that resulted in checkmate around move 180.  That is how difficult this position is.
moves.31... Nd5: Best now is 32. Re1.  If Qf3? then 33. Qd4 and for the moment the black queen is stuck. Qg4 34. Kg2 g5 35. h3 Qf5 36. fxg5 Qxg5 37. Qg4
moves.32... Qe3+ 33. Kh1: Now 33...  Nb4 34. Qb1 Qf3+ 35. Kg1 Qe3+ 36. Kg2 Qe2+ is a draw.
moves.34. Qg2 Qe3 35. Rf1 Qd4 36. Qf3: According to the computer 36. Qe2 would have maintained some advantage, but it is hard to see how white can make progress.
moves.36... Qxb2 37. g4: Now 37... h6 holds.  Then no good is 38. f5 Qxe5
moves.38. f5: If 38... exf5 39. gxf5 Nc7 40. e6 Nxe6 (40...  fxe6 41. Qc3+) 41. fxe6 Qxe6 42. Qc3+ with a winning game.
moves.38... Qd2 39. f6+:
Wrong. 

Correct was 39. fxe6 Nf4 (39... fxe6 40. Qf8#) 40. e7 Qd7 41. Qxf4 Qxe7 42. Qf6+
moves.39... Kf8 40. Qa3+: Now black can hold the game with 40...  Nb4 41. Qf3 Nd5  42. Qa3+ Nb4
moves.40... Kg8 41. Qxa6 Qh6 42. Qc8+ Qf8: Now by far the best move is ...

gameName: Casual game on the Internet Chess Club, ?
